oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Various interviews - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of interviews with Sonny James (performer), Sheb Wooley (performer) and his alter ego Ben Colder (performer), conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Biff Collie introduces Sonny James -- Sonny James talks about dealing with creative blocks as an artist -- James talks about just how many songwriters there are -- James talks about treasuring friendships and family more than anything -- James talks about starting to play guitar at 4 years old and other stringed instruments he has picked up -- Collie concludes the interview -- Collie introduces Ben Colder -- Ben Colder talks about being from Northern Alaska -- Colder talks about where he found inspiration for some of his recordings -- Colder talks about writing Hello Walls -- Colder talks about royalties for his tunes -- Colder talks about -- Colder talks about his new album and the interview concludes -- Collie introduces Sheb Wooley -- Sheb Wooley comments on recording this interview in the car -- Wooley talks about a recent performance and not working in any television programs -- Wooley talks about his record sales -- Wooley talks about the difficulty for him in selling ballads -- Collie concludes the interview -- Wooley talks about being able to read music but not using it much, because he has a person for that -- Wooley talks about lyric writers and music writers working as teams -- Collie introduces Sheb Wooley -- Wooley talks about touring -- Wooley talks about Ben Colder -- Wooley talks about liking the music business more than any of his other artistic endeavors -- Wooley talks about Ben Colder perhaps being the real him -- Wooley talks about feeling different when playing Ben Colder on stage -- Wooley talks about his satirical songwriting process -- Wooley and Biff listen to one of Wooley's records -- Collie concludes the interview
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Collie, Biff; Wooley, Sheb, 1921-2003;
